entries.content: New requirement: Typing indicator needs to be positioned at the bottom where the blinking cursor/caret is, instead of replacing the placeholder content.

Changed typing indicator positioning:
- Before: Replaced .placeholder-content inside placeholder
- After: Appends to bottom of active message list (where cursor would be)
- Indicator now appears at the very bottom of the chat
- Properly removes existing indicator before adding new one
- Updated remove() method to actually remove the indicator from DOM
User reports indicator not showing - only seeing the cursor/caret. Need to investigate how the streaming flow actually works and where indicators should be placed in the existing architecture.

Fixed indicator not showing issue:
- Problem: Called non-existent getActiveMessageList() method
- Solution: Reverted to using getCurrentPlaceholder() - the placeholder is already at the bottom where it should be
- Architecture: PlaceholderCreator creates placeholder at bottom → ClaudeWorkingIndicator replaces its content → indicator appears at bottom
- The placeholder positioning is correct, just needed to work WITH it instead of trying to bypass it
Session ending - indicator still showing at top instead of bottom. Will fix in next session. Need to investigate why placeholder positioning isn't working as expected despite correct architecture.
